title: Changes in the demand for the currency

content.question: Which of the following best explains the change in the international value of the peso caused by a shift of the demand curve from <math alttext="D sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="D sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the dollar-peso foreign exchange market?

choices.label: The peso has appreciated because Americans’ demand for Mexican financial assets increased.
The peso has appreciated because Mexicans’ demand for United States financial assets increased.
The peso has depreciated because Americans’ demand for Mexican goods and services decreased.
The peso has depreciated because Mexicans’ demand for American goods and services decreased.
The peso has depreciated because Americans are unwilling to sell products to Mexico.

content.answer: The peso has depreciated because Americans’ demand for Mexican goods and services decreased.
